critique: The document discusses amending a departmental rule related to employment in the Department of Agriculture. It focuses on specifying conditions for hiring scientific or professional experts, particularly those working outside Washington, D.C. for investigations authorized by Congress. The amendment introduces a requirement for certification by the United States Civil Service Commission for reappointment of experts, ensuring they have passed a suitable examination. It also clarifies that the exception does not apply to employees in Washington, D.C. or those whose duties are not scientific or professional.
